critique: This executive order aims to combat abusive child labor practices by enforcing laws against the manufacture or importation of goods produced by forced or indentured child labor. It directs executive agencies to take appropriate actions, publish a list of products suspected of being made with child labor, and implement procurement regulations to ensure contractors certify they've made efforts to avoid using such products. The order also outlines investigation procedures and remedies for violations. It seems to align with a liberal stance on social issues, particularly concerning human rights and labor standards. It also seems to expand executive power, as it directs agencies to take certain actions and implement new regulations. It also seems to promote federal control, as it directs federal agencies to take action. It also seems to promote social inclusion, as it aims to protect children from forced labor. It also seems to promote economic intervention, as it directs agencies to take action to enforce labor laws. It also seems to promote national security, as it aims to protect the US from goods produced by forced labor.
